Class StudentDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • StudentDatabase
  • public class StudentDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
    The StudentDatabase class represent a list of Student objects.
    Version:
    31 Oct 2021
    Author:
    Tze Loon Neoh

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      StudentDatabase()
      Construct an empty list of students.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addStudent​(Student newStudent)
      Add a Student object to a StudentDatabase object to be processed.
      Student filterStudentByIdentityNumber​(int inputIdentityNumber)
      Given an identity number (an integer), compare the identity number with those of the Student objects stored in a StudentDatabase object to be processed and return, if there is, a Student object with the same identity number.
      StudentDatabase filterStudentsByName​(java.lang.String inputName)
      Given a name (a string of words), compare the name with the names of Student objects stored in a StudentDatabase object to be processed and create a new StudentDatabase object to store, if any, Student object(s) with the same name, and return the StudentDabase object.
      StudentDatabase filterStudentsBySubjects​(SubjectDatabase subjectFilters)
      Given a SubjectDatabase object, iterator through a StudentDatabase object to be processed, store the Student object(s) who has(have) enrolled in all the subjects in the SubjectDatabase object in a new StudentDatabase object, and return the newly created StudentDatabase object.
      StudentDatabase filterStudentsBySuspension​(int integerInput)
      Given an actual parameter (1: suspended or 2: unsuspended), create a StudentDatabase objects to store Student object(s) based on suspension status.
      StudentDatabase filterStudentsNotEnrolled()
      Return the StudentDatabase object containing Student objects not enrolled in any subjects.
      int getSize()
      Return the number of Student objects in a StudentDatabase object to be processed.
      Student getStudent​(int index)
      Given an integer, return a Student object at the (integer)th index in a StudentDatabase object to be processed.
      boolean identityNumberInUse​(int inputIdentityNumber)
      Given an identity number, check if the identity number already exists in a StudentDatabase object to be processed.
      void printStudentDatabase()
      Print out all students on the list.
      void removeStudent​(Student newStudent)
      Remove a Student object from a StudentDatabase object to be processed.
      boolean studentOnDatabase​(java.lang.String inputStudentName, int inputIdentityNumber)
      Given a student name and an identity number, iterate through a StudentDatabase object to be processed and check if there is a Student object in the StudentDatabase object that matches the name and identity number.

        public StudentDatabase()
        Construct an empty list of students.

    • Method Detail

      • printStudentDatabase

        public void printStudentDatabase()
        Print out all students on the list.

      • filterStudentsBySuspension

        public StudentDatabase filterStudentsBySuspension​(int integerInput)
        Given an actual parameter (1: suspended or 2: unsuspended), create a StudentDatabase objects to store Student object(s) based on suspension status.
        Parameters:
        integerInput - The user option to list (1: suspended or 2: unsuspended) students.
        Returns:
        The list of students based on suspension status of user's choice.

      • filterStudentsByName

        public StudentDatabase filterStudentsByName​(java.lang.String inputName)
        Given a name (a string of words), compare the name with the names of Student objects stored in a StudentDatabase object to be processed and create a new StudentDatabase object to store, if any, Student object(s) with the same name, and return the StudentDabase object.
        Parameters:
        inputName - The user input of student name.
        Returns:
        The list of student(s) with the same name as the user input.

      • filterStudentByIdentityNumber

        public Student filterStudentByIdentityNumber​(int inputIdentityNumber)
        Given an identity number (an integer), compare the identity number with those of the Student objects stored in a StudentDatabase object to be processed and return, if there is, a Student object with the same identity number.
        Parameters:
        inputIdentityNumber - The user input of student identity number.
        Returns:
        The Student object with the same identity numbers the user input.

      • studentOnDatabase

        public boolean studentOnDatabase​(java.lang.String inputStudentName,
                                 int inputIdentityNumber)
        Given a student name and an identity number, iterate through a StudentDatabase object to be processed and check if there is a Student object in the StudentDatabase object that matches the name and identity number.
        Parameters:
        inputStudentName - The student name against which comparison is to be made.
        inputIdentityNumber - The student identity number against which comparison is to be made
        Returns:
        true If a Student object of the same name and identity number is found, false otherwise.

      • identityNumberInUse

        public boolean identityNumberInUse​(int inputIdentityNumber)
        Given an identity number, check if the identity number already exists in a StudentDatabase object to be processed.
        Parameters:
        inputIdentityNumber - The student identity number to be processed.
        Returns:
        true If the identity number has already been used for a Student object on the list, false otherwise.

      • addStudent

        public void addStudent​(Student newStudent)
        Add a Student object to a StudentDatabase object to be processed.
        Parameters:
        newStudent - The Student object to be added.

      • removeStudent

        public void removeStudent​(Student newStudent)
        Remove a Student object from a StudentDatabase object to be processed.
        Parameters:
        newStudent - The Student object to be removed.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Return the number of Student objects in a StudentDatabase object to be processed.
        Returns:
        The number of students recorded on the list.

      • getStudent

        public Student getStudent​(int index)
        Given an integer, return a Student object at the (integer)th index in a StudentDatabase object to be processed.
        Returns:
        The student at the given index on the list.

      • filterStudentsBySubjects

        public StudentDatabase filterStudentsBySubjects​(SubjectDatabase subjectFilters)
        Given a SubjectDatabase object, iterator through a StudentDatabase object to be processed, store the Student object(s) who has(have) enrolled in all the subjects in the SubjectDatabase object in a new StudentDatabase object, and return the newly created StudentDatabase object.
        Returns:
        The list of student(s) enrolled in all the subjects in the given list of subjects.

      • filterStudentsNotEnrolled

        public StudentDatabase filterStudentsNotEnrolled()
        Return the StudentDatabase object containing Student objects not enrolled in any subjects.
        Returns:
        The list of students who are not at all enrolled in any subjects.
